Description: Foot and lower wall fragment (mended from three fragments, including 1924,1201.1168) of Corinthian black-figured pottery kotyle; interior: glazed black (only traces remaining); exterior: rays on single band at base of wall; above, black-figure decoration, perhaps part of animal's belly; band on outer and inner face of foot; underside: central dot, two narrow concentric bands and one wide band; to outside, one narrow between two broad bands; most of black lost, only traces remaining.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.1168 and belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.1171.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.078) (Phase 1)
